So what about a system which notifies players who create reports, that their reports have been successful in handing out a punishment?

There's nothing worse than knowing an abusive player is getting away with what they are doing. Having some sort of acknowledgment for reporting, would help create better, clearer and more honest reports, as it embeds trust in the user, that the "system" is doing it's job.

There is a notification system in game right now. It's important to remember that only the report that triggered the action will receive a notification. For instance if a player is being really negative in game, they're likely to get reported by a lot of people.

It's the report that triggers that will receive a notification. This basically means that you won't receive a notification for every player that is punished by your reports, but you will see it sometimes when your report triggers the action.

The system is being fine-tuned by the PBJ team to try and improve the feedback loop you are part of as someone sending in reports.

The end of season was about 12 hours ago - at 12:01AM on November 11. Your rank at that point is what determines what rewards you get at end of season.

From now on, we're actually in the 2016 Preseason - with all the changes that go with it. Ranked is still available during preseason - and you can still promote as you would during the season, but it won't impact your rewards for the 2015 Season, and you'll still have to go through the normal provisional process when next season starts.

The way that ranked resets at the beginning of the season isn't a hard reset to put everyone at the same value - everyone is reset to a level that is relative to their rating at the start of the season. (This avoids the problem of having really strong players playing weaker players early in the season) This means that the games in the preseason can have an effect on where you start after placements next season.

The most stupid part of your system is this situation:
-Someone starts shit talking.
-You shit talk back.
-You aren't a whingy little bitch so you don't bother reporting, you just go about your day like anyone with the maturity level of a five year old or above would.
-Whingy little bitch who started the shit talk reports you, cause immature.
-You get banned.

See the problem with the above contradicts this statement.
"We view aggregate report data as the collective voice of the playerbase and the main way the community defines and establishes standards of behavior. When reporting a player, you add your voice to that chorus"

People who shit talk, then report retaliations CLEARLY don't find shit talking to be that serious of an issue, otherwise they wouldn't do it themselves.

You should update your system to discount the reports of people who are commiting the same offence. "I am reporting you because I think players shouldn't be doing the exact same thing that I am doing". You've got the instant feedback system there to check if players are behaving themselves, how about using it for something productive rather than banning the mundane bullshit banter in premade games. 
(Yes this happens, if you shittalk with your friends but someone on the enemy team is a sore lose and reports you all, the system will see your banter between friends as abuse and punish you for it.) At least the Tribunal had some context detection.
If someone shit talks you, you don't have to say a single word in response. Not 1 word. So just mute and keep playing the game, and their report on you won't mean anything at the end of the game...
Especially when the above situation can permanently taint your good record as a summoner.

I agree. If you talk shit, your report on someone else for shit talking should be discarded. Same should go with any offence. If you report someone for feeding and you are 5/20 then that report should be discarded.
That way players would know that for their report to be effective and taken seriously they have to take the equal opposite action during the game, thus giving a reason to "not shit talk back". This would encourage the use of the mute button over retaliation because the players wants their report to be effective. Make sense? Thoughts?

Didn't gank, EVER, didn't realise I was being 2-3 man ganked on top of the already top laner and considering how much I was being ganked, wasn't actually feeding too badly.

Complained further about mid laner, started to complain about all of us for making him lose and yaddy yadda.

And that was in both games, both times the exact same scenario with his attitude, albeit less ganks from mid laner to top.

Shortly after that, about 3 days later, I got him again and AGAIN he had the same attitude and went the exact same way, complained about someone, complained about someone else, complained we were losing him the game, yet made ZERO ganks, and when I say zero, I don't mean not much, I mean NONE at all, didn't one in the entire three games step into someone's lane, just sat in the jungle and complained we were losing the game for him.

About a week later, got him again, this time he started complaining about us all in the team chat, I couldn't dodge that game, it was my 5th promotion game. He done the same shit again, and we lost, no surprise.

If I mute him and see him playing bad, I can only assume he is bad, the same as someone who plays bad and never talks, but the minute they open their mouth and start shit talking, that is reportable.

It really should be though, the goal of ranked is winning. 

 Riot keep posting all these stupid skewed messages regarding the correlation between toxicity and losing games. Feeding, be it intentional or not is more detrimental to the game than calling people names. That's a fact.

 Furthermore, I don't often see the "toxicity" start until after the feed has begun, at which point the game would probably be a loss whether people talk or not. They really need to look at the cause of toxicity as opposed to sticking their fingers in their ears yelling "lalalalala cant hear you time for ban." 

 Yeah, yeah.. everyone has a bad game and going 2-10 once a month shouldnt be punished, but when you are constantly going 2-10 you should have some form of consequence. Ranked limitations should be considered, to stop people who just aren't ready to work as a team or listen to advice. 

 Going 0-20 for 10 straight games and getting called a noob in every match hurts the feelings of one player. Going 0-20 hurts the feelings of 40, even a possible 90. Are we really saying that one persons mindset is worth more than 90 peoples?

The Instant Feedback System can trigger immediately after a game. There will be cases where that player may have actually been punished - with chat restrictions for instance - but you will see them in game again straight after.

It's also important to remember that the Instant Feedback System is being ramped up over time. So you might see someone that was borderline negative in a game and then will be picked up as the settings on the system increase.
